I have had a quick look at JXUnit. It works in a similar way, but 
seems to=
o complex. I want something simple..

Cheers

--- In junit@y..., Robert Lef=
twich <digital@i...> wrote:
> At 10:58 PM 7/11/2001 +0000, gavinlas@h... wr=
ote:
> >Hello,
> >
> >I have been looking at creating a configurable test s=
uite and test
> >cases.
> >
> >Snip...
> >All comments, advice or suggestio=
ns are welcome.
> 
> You might want to take a look at JxUnit at 
> http://s=
ourceforge.net/projects/jxunit/ or 
> http://quickutil.sourceforge.net/view=
/Main/JXUnit where it says:
> 
> JXUnit is a directory-driven test scriptin=
g which builds on JUnit 
and JXQuick.
> Test data plays a central role in t=
esting. From the lowest level 
(method 
> tests) to the highest (acceptance=
 tests), a test involves input 
data, 
> expected output data, and a compar=
ison between the expected and 
actual 
> output data.
> JXUnit separates te=
st data from test code. This has several 
advantages:
> =B7       Test data=
 can be edited, making it easy to add additional 
test cases;
> =B7       T=
est data can be validated, as a means of reducing "false 
> failures"; and
=
> =B7       Test data can be externally generated or captured from a 
produ=
ction 
> process.
> 
> Robert
